idlastro/coyote/

fsc_ps_setup__define.pro


NAME: FSC_PS_SETUP__DEFINE

PURPOSE:

The purpose of FSC_PS_SETUP__DEFINE is to define a structure that is use with PS_START and PS_END, programs that make it easy to set-up for and close a PostScript file. The programs work in close conjunction with PSCONFIG, another program from the Coyote Library.

AUTHOR:

FANNING SOFTWARE CONSULTING David Fanning, Ph.D. 1645 Sheely Drive Fort Collins, CO 80526 USA Phone: 970-221-0438 E-mail: david@idlcoyote.com Coyote's Guide to IDL Programming: http://www.idlcoyote.com/

CATEGORY:

Graphics, File Output, PostScript

CALLING SEQUENCE:

Used internally in PS_START and PS_END.

COMMON BLOCKS:

_$FSC_PS_START_ Contains the PS_STRUCT structure for communication between PS_START and PS_END.

MODIFICATION HISTORY:

Separated from PS_START file, 7 April 2009, by David W. Fanning. Added PAGETYPE field to structure. 8 August 2009. DWF. Changes to handle inability to create raster files from PS encapsulated files in landscape mode. Added "encapsulated" field to structure. 26 Aug 2011. DWF.
